info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:29AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL BEAVER...SOUTHWESTERN BUTLER AND NORTH CENTRAL ALLEGHENY COUNTIES THROUGH 700 AM EDT... At 629 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Brighton, or near Beaver Falls, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Ross Township, McCandless Township, Cranberry, Franklin Park, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Monaca, Economy, Ambridge, Wexford, New Brighton, and Beaver. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 13 and 34. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 70 and 88. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 31 and 43. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
